p: Initial signs and symptoms of SARS are nonspecific and common, which generates a wide differential diagnosis of respiratory pathogens including influenza virus, parainfluenza viruses, respiratory syncytial virus, Haemophilus influenza, Mycoplasma pneumonia, Chlamydia species, Legionella species, Coxiella burnetii, and other human coronaviruses (WHO 2004b).
